When do you say “grew up” or “have grown up” or “have been growing up” in English? The first two phrases (grew up and have grown up) are in the past and are used differently than “have been growing up.” Here are sentences using these phrases. I grew up in the 1960s during the last years of the Vietnam War and the years leading up to the Moon Landing.That being the case, I would have grown up reading headlines about the Vietnam War and stories about space travel.Having just turned sixteen, Anna retorted, “Dad, I have been growing up for a long time now. When will you trust me with boys?”
